programme.desc: Part one of two. Troubled private investigator Jackson Brodie visits a regular client to help look for her lost cat - but the seemingly innocuous task takes a peculiar turn when her neighbours plead with him to find their sister, who went missing 30 years previously. However, his priorities become complicated when an old acquaintance arrives at his office. Crime drama, based on the novels by Kate Atkinson, starring Jason Isaacs and Amanda Abbington, with Sylvia Syms, Natasha Little, Fenella Woolgar and Phil Davis

programme.title: Case Histories
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jackson continues to investigate the disappearance of Olivia Land, and visits the murder victim's father Theo Wyre, who is devastated by Laura's death. Crime drama, starring Jason Isaacs, Amanda Abbington and Natasha Little

programme.desc: A convicted paedophile is spotted taking photographs of children by Rebus and a close colleague, who apparently reacts badly to the incident as he turns up dead the next day. However, the distraught detective thinks there's more to it than plain suicide. He vows to get to the bottom of the mystery, but soon becomes distracted by a plea from an old girlfriend to find her missing teenage son. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah, Mark Bonnar and Michelle Fairley

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ann and Lucy present a tiny metal table that's on its last legs. The table was made by Ann's grandfather Joseph over 100 years ago for her mother Dora when she was a little girl. Knowing they'd like the table to be robust enough to pass on to the next generation, silversmith Brenton West gets to work to put the wobbly-legged item on firmer footing once again. The experts also revive a 100-year-old shipping log charting the bravery of a seafarer during the Second World War

British record-holder Matthew Hudson-Smith claimed bronze in the 400m last year in Eugene, with USA's Michael Norman winning gold and Kirani James of Grenada taking silver

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two paramedics recall their experiences at the scene of the London Bridge attacks, where in June 2017 a van was deliberately driven into pedestrians. In Manchester, the police launch a new initiative to crack down on knife crime

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When two men are wrongly convicted of murder, a forensic blood spatter analyst helps to prove their innocence. Plus, an expert witness uses mobile phone analysis to help police bring a gang of drug traffickers to justice. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood joins workers at the Port of Tyne, helping to unload cargo containers from the quayside, and discovering how their contents are transported around the country

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Terraces in Plastow in south-east London and Porth in south Wales along with a three-bedroom detached house in Crystal Palace in south-east London are sold at auction. Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of those successful bidders as they attempt to rejuvenate thier acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bliss and Tim Weeks are on hand as two teams go head to head at an antiques fair in Builth Wells, Brecknockshire, searching for bargains to sell for profit at auction. Host Charlie Ross also visits a grand hall built in the early 1880s, now a museum, but once the local courtroom with accommodation for the judge in residence, all under one roof

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Amur tigers are the largest of the species and are part of a vital international breeding programme. For this reason that Rusty must leave the park as he has been selected to move to Blackpool Zoo, where he will hopefully become father to cubs of his own. Plus, the parrots have a dance-off. Presented by Ben Fogle, Kate Humble, Hamza Yassin and Megan McCubbin

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Rame Peninsula. Far from the traditional tourist track, this part of Cornwall is famed for its cliffs and beaches. It's also where he meets a beachcomber who has found some remarkable objects washed up on the shore

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah searches for homes in Totnes in Devon for a buyer with a budget of 320,000, who wants to trade her hectic life in London for the slower pace of a market town

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A prankster postman's brass horn is revived, along with a historic 1920s teddy bear of tiny proportions that doubles up as a perfume bottle and a tavern clock that's over 200 years old. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the evening session on day seven from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, including the women's and men's 200m finals at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively. Great Britain's Dina Asher-Smith claimed 200m gold in 2019 and took bronze last year behind the formidable Jamaican duo of Shericka Jackson and Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce. Asher-Smith's compatriot Zarnell Hughes will also hope to be in contention in the men's race, but reigning champion Noah Lyles of USA looks to be the favourite once again

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining celebrities must cook a faultless two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also John Partridge (series champion 2018), Judi Love (Christmas champion 2021), and 2022 finalist Melanie Blatt. All three know what it takes to get through this competition, and tonight they are in for a treat as the contenders pull out all the stops to secure their semi-final place

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Diane puts her trust in Kath, sending her on a covert mission to Martin's office while she reluctantly accompanies her spouse to a dinner party at Sandy Cooper's home. In a desperate attempt to address his financial woes, Martin tries to impress Sandy and Vinnie Hayes to secure the treasury job and get his hands on the Rotary Club float. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill and Rosie Cavaliero

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Point Break (1991)
programme.desc: An FBI agent infiltrates a Californian surfing gang suspected of carrying out a series of armed robberies wearing masks modelled on former US presidents. However, his loyalties are tested to the limits when he is befriended by the gang's leader. Kathryn Bigelow's thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Patrick Swayze, Gary Busey and Lori Petty

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn, and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish lamb, cooking spicy Moroccan lamb chops with grilled veg couscous. Joining them in the kitchen are Sutherland Sheep Farmer Joyce Campbell and food and drink writer Rosalind Erskine, who's mixing and pouring a Shetland gin Southside cocktail

programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Fulham and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest. Plus, news from Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur

Eric Knowles monitors proceedings and also challenges the crowds to guess the function of an intriguing piece of Victorian paraphernalia

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, rescuing a well-used table, a retro chair and rusty gate rods from the skip

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Birmingham to find a home in Cornwall, and visits a company making habitats for solitary bees which can also be used in the construction of houses

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Philip and Lorraine in Stockport want to transform their forgotten plot into a stately garden, on a budget of 4,750, with secret passageways, big urns, a beautiful tiled patio and lots of posh planting. Charlie Dimmock takes on the Rich Brothers to come up with a design that would not look out of place in a stately home.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Kelly Somers presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the evening session on day eight from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are up for grabs in seven events. The decathlon concludes with the javelin from 6.05 and the 1500m at 8.25, and Great Britain will expect to be in contention in the men's and women's 4x100m relays at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively given the wealth of talent at their disposal. The other finals are the men's pole vault at 6.25, the women's shot put from 7.15, the men's 800m at 7.30 and the women's 5,000m, at 7.50

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna deals with an angry Max after her confession. Rida comes to Rash's rescue. Hospital drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Fulham at Emirates Stadium and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest at Old Trafford. The Gunners are aiming to finish one better than last term when they were runners-up, but faced a potentially tough test against a Fulham side that performed well last term. The Red Devils and Forest met four times in all competitions last season, with United winning every contest. Plus, Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United and Chelsea v Luton Town

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2 (2013)
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Both of them become targets of Dave's twisted former friend, who has reinvented himself as the world's first supervillain. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits Sketty near Swansea to see a three-bed semi with original features and heads to Ilfracombe, North Devon to see a two-bedroom with a bad first impression. Tommy Walsh is in London on the Isle of dogs where a three-bed flat has great development potential

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble go behind the scenes at Longleat House and Safari Park

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Lou and Steve moved to Devon from London so their children, who are both deaf, could attend a specialist school. When they first saw the house, it wasn't love at first sight, but they decided to buy it because of its beautiful location. Now they have decided to fix the problems with their home, and they are many - from the imposing steps at the front, to the extensions causing a series of disconnected rooms. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lizzie Fraher, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the sixth and concluding semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of William Pitt the Younger, The Bridge, the Grand National, and the plays of Joe Orton, before they are each tested on general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin heads to Derby as vintage enthusiast Ryan Goodyear takes on entrepreneur Lorraine Meadowcroft in the antiques-buying challenge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Alex Greene, Chris McClurg and Glen Wheeler serve up their music-themed mains and desserts. Chris cooks his interpretation of the classic beef dish Tournedos Rossini using guinea fowl, inspired by musicians who mix classical and modern styles. Alex Greene's dish commemorates his late brother and the song that helped him through the time of his death, while Glen serves up his chicken in a model of the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury - complete with stage smoke

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his search through previously classified documents in the National Archives, learning how Mary Whitehouse defended God in a court of law. He also discloses details of the last woman to be imprisoned under the Witchcraft Acts, and unearths files that reveal the Church's role in slavery

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon appraise antiques at Guildford Cathedral, with items including a Moorcroft bowl and a wooden snuff holder. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of day six from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the finals of the men's long jump and women's hammer get under way at 6.30 and 7.15 respectively, with China's Wang Jianan and Brooke Andersen of USA the reigning champions. On the track, the women's and men's 200m semi-finals take place at 6.45 and 7.20, and the men's 800m semis at 7.50

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to street food which is experiencing a boom when the industry is struggling. In the West Midlands, Tom meets Jack Brabant and James Swinburne, founders of an expanding street food collective called Digbeth Dining Club. They curate street food events and venues, bringing together the best independent local traders with DJs and live music to create a new kind of dining experience

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Cherry Healey get special access to the JCB factory in Rocester in Staffordshire, where as many as a hundred iconic yellow diggers are made every single day. Gregg follows the production of their best-known model, the backhoe loader, so-called because it has got a loader shovel on the front and a hoe arm for digging on the back

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Things get awkward over the radio as Hendy and April reveal to Stokes and Carol that they recently went on a date together. Elsewhere, there is anxiety for Carol as her wayward son Lachy has been suspended from school again

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Walsall's top social media talent Manrika reveals how to be a successful and in-demand influencer, including tips on interacting with followers, promoting an aspirational lifestyle, selling healthy habits and negotiating hotel stays. Comedy, starring Manrika Khaira

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi return from a blissful vacation only to be crushed by reality. Orna has a breakthrough with Sean. Josh and Natasha make a surprising turn

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: It comes down to the wire as the planners battle to impress the judges and pull off a millionaire's garden party for Lauren and Jodie

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel by seaplane to go behind the scenes of Joali hotel resort in the Maldives, which offers guests a luxury experience despite its remote location. Rob discovers there are 300 workers hidden in the centre of the island, while Monica finds out how food is supplied to the island chefs. They realise that delivering paradise is like a giant theatre production

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Kingston upon Thames in Surrey, with experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Eric also discovers the fascinating life of florist Constance Spry

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble go behind the scenes at Longleat House and Safari Park

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill gives viewers an update on her first garden, and shares a new structure designed especially for her compact plot. Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life. In the Cotswolds, Advolly Richmond showcases one of the finest examples of gardening in the arts and crafts era

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents live coverage of day seven from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the decathlon gets under way with the 100m at 9.05, the long jump from 9.55 and the shot put from 11.20, with title holder Kevin Mayer of France and Canada's Olympic champion Damian Warner expected to renew their rivalry. Men's javelin qualifying also takes place from 9.10

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical tour through the BBC's culinary archive, this time selecting recipes and ingredients linked by the letter B. The programme includes clips of Levi Roots preparing beef pepperpot stew, and Nigel Slater cooking a spiced bread and butter pudding

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the 10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys asks the questions for the last time as six contestants take to the famous black chair in the final of the quiz, with specialist subjects of Shackleton's Antarctic expedition of 1914-17, Cole Porter, the Vienna Secession, Jimmy Carter, Flanders and Swann, and the films of David Cronenberg

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Croydon, south London, teaching actress Anne and government employee Paul a few tricks of the antiques-buying trade to see who can make the most profit

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from Northern Ireland try to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton, who are joined on the panel by hip-hop musician Loyle Carner. They are competing to cook at the final banquet, which takes place this year at Abbey Road Studios to mark 50 years since the Beatles played live together for the last time

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his search through the National Archives, unearthing memos relating to one of the SAS's most daring raids and documents pertaining to a conspiracy to overthrow the government. He also looks at how Churchill thought the unthinkable in the wake of defeating the Nazis

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at the historic Oxford Union. Christina Trevanion picks out a famous fake, and Mark Stacey examines a rare Baptist bust. Meanwhile, Paul looks into the history of the auction site, which is built on top of Greenham Common

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the evening session on day seven from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the women's triple jump and javelin finals get under way at 6.35 and 7.20 respectively. Venzuela's Yulimar Rojas will be looking for her fourth successive world triple jump title, while it would also be a surprise if Australian Kelsey-Lee Barber is not in contention to win her third gold in the javelin. On the track, the men's and women's 4x100m heats take place at 6.30 and 7.00 and the women's 800m semi-finals at 7.25

programme.title: Rob Burrow: Living with MND
programme.desc: Rob Burrow, one of Leeds Rhinos' greatest players, was diagnosed with motor neurone disease in late 2019. His family now care for his every need, 24 hours a day. This documentary illustrates the love, support and challenges faced by his wife Lindsey, children Macy, Maya and Jackson, and parents Geoff and Irene. Rob discusses his treatment with the NHS staff caring for him, while best friend and former team-mate Kevin Sinfield continues to rally support in Leeds and from the wider rugby league community

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter discusses the many bugs, blights and diseases that can attack plants. She addresses what they are, the damage they can do, and how best to stop them. Diana Yates will be reviewing her own vertical garden area that demonstrates planting ideas for those with small gardens and balconies

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals how to take cuttings from herbs and prunes summer raspberries. He also plants daylilies and gives topiary Nigel a timely trim. Adam Frost travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet, and windy weather

programme.title: The Real Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Carl Chinn explores the evolution of the gang from a mass movement interested in territory and fighting into the first organised crime group in Britain. He follows the career of Birmingham petty thief Billy Kimber who - with his Birmingham gang - rose to dominate the money-spinning illegal rackets around the growing sport of horse racing at the start of the 20th century. The First World War disrupted his quest to build an empire, but after the war Kimber moved south to take over the rackets in the lucrative southern racecourses

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the sci-fi comedy series. After three million years in suspended animation, Dave Lister awakes to find he's the last surviving member of the human race, with only a mutated cat and a hologram of his least favourite crewmate for company. Craig Charles and Chris Barrie star

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at Nusfjord Arctic Resort, a preserved 200-year-old cod-fishing village in the Lofoten Islands of Norway. Working alongside the dedicated staff, Monica and Rob learn to appreciate the difficulties of running a high-end resort in such an extreme environment as they battle snowy paths with housekeeping, face huge waves on fishing boats and chase the Northern Lights

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to street food which is experiencing a boom when the industry is struggling. In the West Midlands, Tom meets Jack Brabant and James Swinburne, founders of an expanding street food collective called Digbeth Dining Club. They curate street food events and venues, bringing together the best independent local traders with DJs and live music to create a new kind of dining experience

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi struggle to get on the same page, Orna helps Josh to make a connection between his past and present and Nadine comes clean about her feelings for another lover

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the home repair policies that have failed to live up to buyers' expectations, the car insurance that have caused headaches instead of peace of mind and the funeral plans that have fallen apart

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Former care worker Georgie is given the chance to list a 15 million house, but first she has to prove her business credentials to veteran broker Danny. Ex-model Vanesa lands a 15 million euro villa overlooking Monaco, but she needs to sell it before the end of the summer or the owner will take it off the market. With only 10 days to prepare she decides to throw an open house to gain some momentum, but will the bold decision pay off and land her with an offer?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day eight from Budapest, Hungary, including the women's marathon from 6.00, which was won by Ethiopia's Gotytom Gebreslase in Eugene in 2022. Plus, the decathlon continues with the 110m hurdles at 9.05 and the discus from 10.00

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day eight from Budapest, Hungary, including the women's marathon from 6.00, which was won by Ethiopia's Gotytom Gebreslase in Eugene in 2022. Plus, the decathlon continues with the 110m hurdles at 9.05 and the discus from 10.00

programme.title: Caribbean Food Made Easy
programme.desc: In Glasgow, Levi Roots tempts shoppers with an aromatic pineapple dessert, before taking to the seas to meet Mull fishermen. He also lays on the ultimate Caribbean cricket tea for two teams of hungry Yorkshiremen

programme.title: The Third Man (1949)
programme.desc: American writer Holly Martins goes to post-Second World War Vienna at the invitation of his old friend Harry Lime, only to find he has died. However, the author finds the circumstances surrounding his death fail to add up and goes in search of the truth - but is unprepared for the ugly secrets he uncovers. Carol Reed's thriller, written by Graham Greene, starring Joseph Cotten, Orson Welles, Alida Valli and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents live coverage of the women's eliminator (Start-time 2.30pm), which comes from The Kia Oval, as the second and third-placed sides battle it out for a place in the final. Southern Brave edged out Trent Rockets by two runs at this stage of the 2022 tournament with the help of Nat Sciver's excellent innings of 72 off just 36 balls

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and bringing brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin takes a journey down the River Tweed and uncovers the history of the unusual border town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Dr Xander Van Tulleken cruise across the Welsh border in a couple of large classic American motors, guided on their hunt for antiques by experts Irita Marriott and Serhat Ahmet. Xand and Serhat discover their shared love of ceramics and set out to find the perfect piece to take to auction, while Irita and Gethin face a battle for some porcelain pigs

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon are challenged to a cricket match by Warden Hodges, who has signed up a professional for his side. Featuring a guest appearance by former England and Yorkshire fast bowler Fred Trueman. Vintage comedy first shown in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee

programme.title: Northern Soul at the Proms
programme.desc: Andi Oliver presents a concert from the Royal Albert Hall in which Edwin Outwater conducts the BBC Concert Orchestra in a celebration of Northern Soul club culture, which took English towns across the industrial north and the Midlands by storm in the 1960s and 1970s. Curated by Stuart Maconie and Joe Duddell, the show features singers Vula Malinga, Frida Touray, Natalie Palmer, Brendan Reilly Nick Shirm and Darrell Smith. Recorded on July 15

programme.title: Shania Twain at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection featuring all of the Canadian singer-songwriter's biggest moments from the BBC archives. Including live performances, her earliest UK TV appearances from the days of debut hit Still the One, and classics That Don't Impress Me Much and Man! I Feel Like a Woman!

programme.title: Madonna at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at a selection of the singer's appearances on a range of BBC shows - from her first Top of the Pops appearance with Holiday in 1984 through to recent years. This collection covers the singer's journey from Material Girl to Queen of Pop. It captures how, over the years, her ability to combine charisma, controversy and classic pop tunes has made her a female icon and a true global superstar

programme.title: Madonna Rebel Heart Tour
programme.desc: Directors Danny B Tull and Nathan Rissman showcase the American pop singer's 2015-2016 world tour via as-live footage and candid behind-the-scenes coverage from the various venues that played host to the exuberant Queen of Pop. Includes performances of Madonna's most recent hits, along with classic tunes from throughout her decades-long career, such as Living for Love, Material Girl, Holiday, and an acoustic version of Like a Prayer

programme.title: Madonna: Truth or Dare (1991)
programme.desc: Documentary following the outspoken pop superstar's 1990 Blonde Ambition international tour, featuring candid behind-the-scenes and performance footage, including her raunchy and controversial stage version of early hit Like a Virgin. Featuring interviews with family members, plus guest appearances by Warren Beatty, Kevin Costner and Sandra Bernhard

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day nine from Budapest, Hungary, featuring the men's marathon from 6.00. Tamirat Tola of Ethiopia was the victorious athlete last year in Eugene, with his compatriot Mosinet Geremew finishing second and Bashir Abdi of Belgium taking bronze

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Britain's northernmost station at Thurso in Caithness, Michael Portillo heads for the ferry port of Scrabster to cross the Pentland Firth to the Orkney Islands. Passing the Old Man of Hoy, Michael takes in stunning views of the Orkney archipelago and the rugged coastlines of its 70 islands

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle scales Britain's most renowned structures to tell the story of how constructions have changed over a period of 1,000 years, beginning with Durham Cathedral - one of the finest surviving examples of Norman architecture in the UK. He encounters the crumbling millennium-old stone with oyster shells hiding in the mortar, discovers carved stone arches and braves a tightrope nearly 100 feet above the nave. He is aided on his travels by Lucy Creamer, one of the country's top climbers

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The first of two programmes originally shown to mark the 80th birthday of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, celebrating his long career in showbusiness, from his renowned portrayal of gangster Pinkie in Graham Greene's Brighton Rock to his white-haired Dr John Hammond in Jurassic Park. With contributions from friends and family. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Shadowlands (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Part two of two. Profile of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, charting his long career in showbusiness and following his day-to-day life as he visits a Leicester disability centre and addresses the students of Sussex University. With contributions from David Attenborough, John Attenborough, Sheila Sim and Ben Kingsley. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: An insight into the life and work of actor and director Richard Attenborough, with vintage interviews and classic archive clips illustrating a career that made him one of British cinema's most popular and successful figures. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: The success of RKO Radio Pictures through the eyes of those who worked there, concluding with a look at Howard Hughes buying the company - and the devastating effect it had on the studio. Edward Asner presents, with contributions from Janet Leigh, Joan Fontaine, Jane Russell, Joan Simmons, Jane Greer, Robert Mitchum and Stewart Granger

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Britain's northernmost station at Thurso in Caithness, Michael Portillo heads for the ferry port of Scrabster to cross the Pentland Firth to the Orkney Islands. Passing the Old Man of Hoy, Michael takes in stunning views of the Orkney archipelago and the rugged coastlines of its 70 islands

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle scales Britain's most renowned structures to tell the story of how constructions have changed over a period of 1,000 years, beginning with Durham Cathedral - one of the finest surviving examples of Norman architecture in the UK. He encounters the crumbling millennium-old stone with oyster shells hiding in the mortar, discovers carved stone arches and braves a tightrope nearly 100 feet above the nave. He is aided on his travels by Lucy Creamer, one of the country's top climbers

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Conductor John Wilson and his orchestral supergroup, the Sinfonia of London, continue the 150th anniversary celebrations of Rachmaninov with his much-loved Second Piano Concerto. The Rachmaninov takes centre stage, with its hauntingly beautiful melodies written as the composer overcame his depression, resulting in one of the most beloved pieces of classical music of all time. Lili Boulanger was close to death when she wrote her enchanting D'un Matin de Printemps, which nevertheless brings an optimistic spring morning to begin the evening. The second half of the programme enters the emotional world of William Walton's First Symphony, an intense work charting a tumultuous love affair. Presenter Petroc Trelawny is joined by special guests Wayne Marshall and Hannah Catherine Jones at the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read and Tommy Vance host the show aired on August 23 1984, with Alphaville, Elton John, Break Machine, Miami Sound Machine, Tracey Ullman, Spandau Ballet, Rod Stewart and George Michael

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds introduces the programme shown on August 26, 1976 - the final week in which Elton John & Kiki Dee's Don't Go Breaking My Heart topped the chart. Manfred Mann's Earth Band perform their future top 10 hit Blinded by the Light, and the show also features Acker Bilk, the Stylistics, Cliff Richard, Robin Sarstedt and Gallagher & Lyle, as well as dance routines by Ruby Flipper

programme.title: The Carpenters: A World in Music
programme.desc: A concert by the duo recorded at the New London Theatre in 1976. programme.title: The Eagles: In Concert
programme.desc: Footage of Californian country rockers the Eagles from 1973, performing classic US hits such as Peaceful Easy Feeling, Witchy Woman and Take It Easy. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, jellyfish are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: We meet five-year-old Henry and his family: Mummy, Mama, and little sister Sophie. There's lots of fun in store with a breakfast boogie and a visit to a farm. Back at home, they have some bouncy fun on the trampoline, and they find a tiny visitor in need of rescuing. But will they get the ladybird to safety?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lola's family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lola's friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? There's a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Zahra-Rose's family is from Somalia, a country situated on the east coast of Africa. In Somalia, they have the traditional dish of nafaqo, which is boiled egg wrapped in mashed potato. This is what Zahra-Rose has chosen to make for her friends. To begin with, Zahra-Rose seasons mashed potato with salt, black pepper, flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder and fresh coriander. She then wraps the potato mixture around her special ingredient, hard-boiled eggs, rolls them in breadcrumbs and puts them in the oven to be cooked. Zahra-Rose also serves a fresh chilli sauce, so her friends can use it for dipping. Not only does Zahra-Rose have beautiful decorations, she also has a surprise picnic planned. Will her friends realise what her special ingredient is?

British record-holder Matthew Hudson-Smith claimed bronze in the 400m last year in Eugene, with USA's Michael Norman winning gold and Kirani James of Grenada taking silver

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

After the 30-year-old went missing in 1994, it was discovered that he was acting as a drug courier between London and Swansea. When his body was not found, he was presumed dead and a rumour quickly spread that he had been murdered. A remarkable chain of events led the police to a hillside near Swansea, where they located a fragment of bone that became key in the investigation

Charlie Dimmock takes on the Rich Brothers to come up with a design that would not look out of place in a stately home.

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of Dai Chant, the former coxswain of the St David's Lifeboat, who has since suffered a stroke. His son discovered that objects connected to the sea stirred up old memories, so helps him to return to the sea for the first time in 30 years, and to revisit the scene of his most terrifying rescue, when in 1989, a fishing boat lost control close to the rocks beneath the Bishop Rock Lighthouse

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Documentary following ice swimmer Cath Pendleton and her dream of swimming a mile in the coldest continent on the planet - Antarctica. A health worker with no real money or support team behind her, her training regime involves sitting in a chest freezer in the garden shed. Will her determination be enough to achieve her dream?

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Kelly Somers presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the evening session on day eight from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are up for grabs in seven events. The decathlon concludes with the javelin from 6.05 and the 1500m at 8.25, and Great Britain will expect to be in contention in the men's and women's 4x100m relays at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively given the wealth of talent at their disposal. The other finals are the men's pole vault at 6.25, the women's shot put from 7.15, the men's 800m at 7.30 and the women's 5,000m, at 7.50

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Fulham at Emirates Stadium and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest at Old Trafford. The Gunners are aiming to finish one better than last term when they were runners-up, but faced a potentially tough test against a Fulham side that performed well last term. The Red Devils and Forest met four times in all competitions last season, with United winning every contest. Plus, Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United and Chelsea v Luton Town

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2 (2013)
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A Birmingham police officer is stabbed in the neck while trying to execute an arrest. In Hull an officer and his faithful police dog come under a violent attack

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a woman is the victim of an acid attack in Brighton, an expert pieces together hours of CCTV footage to identify the suspect. Plus, through a process of pollen analysis, an expert witness helps police solve a murder case

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood takes a walk on the wild side, working as a zookeeper at the largest zoo in the UK. As he mucks in, he discovers that the zoo's conservation efforts are helping make sure that many of these endangered species survive in the wild for generations to come

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin follow progress on ambitious projects to bring back to life a pair of semi-detached cottages in Churchtown in Lancashire and two developments in Kent - a tired end terrace in Dover and a purpose-built flat in Margate

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and experts Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell search for antiques in Wrexham, north Wales before heading to Lichfield, Staffordshire, for the auction. Natasha also discovers the history of St Giles Church

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A feud is brewing in the meerkat enclosure - and it's a family affair. To try to bring them together and allow them to work out their pecking order, keeper Charlie has a plan. Plus, a legendary lion turns 18. Presented by Ben Fogle, Kate Humble, Hamza Yassin and Megan McCubbin

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Steve Brown takes a couple round the West Yorkshire market town of Wetherby, showing them properties for their 550,000 budget and also exploring the local cafes and horticulture

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ann and Lucy present a tiny metal table that's on its last legs. The table was made by Ann's grandfather Joseph over 100 years ago for her mother Dora when she was a little girl. Knowing they'd like the table to be robust enough to pass on to the next generation, silversmith Brenton West gets to work to put the wobbly-legged item on firmer footing once again. The experts also revive a 100-year-old shipping log charting the bravery of a seafarer during the Second World War

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey panics when she finds out someone has trashed her bedroom and Bobby enlists Peter's help in turning the chippy into a success so Kathy won't sell. Anton gives Yolande an ultimatum and Peter tries to stop the budding relationship between his siblings

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby orders Peter to leave and Cindy senses that something is wrong. Martin returns from Bulgaria and Stacey tries to keep the break-in a secret from him. Janet gets her GCSE results

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of day six from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, featuring three finals on the track - the women's 100m hurdles at 8.25, the men's 400m at 8.35 and the women's 400m hurdles at 8.50. British record-holder Matthew Hudson-Smith claimed bronze in the 400m last year in Eugene, with USA's Michael Norman winning gold and Kirani James of Grenada taking silver

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

Director Bill Condon's crime thriller based on the novel by Nicholas Searle, starring Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah searches for homes in Totnes in Devon for a buyer with a budget of 320,000, who wants to trade her hectic life in London for the slower pace of a market town

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the evening session on day seven from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, including the women's and men's 200m finals at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively. Great Britain's Dina Asher-Smith claimed 200m gold in 2019 and took bronze last year behind the formidable Jamaican duo of Shericka Jackson and Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce. Asher-Smith's compatriot Zarnell Hughes will also hope to be in contention in the men's race, but reigning champion Noah Lyles of USA looks to be the favourite once again

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining celebrities must cook a faultless two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also John Partridge (series champion 2018), Judi Love (Christmas champion 2021), and 2022 finalist Melanie Blatt. All three know what it takes to get through this competition, and tonight they are in for a treat as the contenders pull out all the stops to secure their semi-final place

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Diane puts her trust in Kath, sending her on a covert mission to Martin's office while she reluctantly accompanies her spouse to a dinner party at Sandy Cooper's home. In a desperate attempt to address his financial woes, Martin tries to impress Sandy and Vinnie Hayes to secure the treasury job and get his hands on the Rotary Club float. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill and Rosie Cavaliero

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: A decade-by-decade look at Welsh pop artists of the past. This episode focuses on the 1980s, with appearances by Visage, the Alarm, Scritti Politti, Shakin' Stevens, the Darling Buds and music veteran Tom Jones with Art of Noise

programme.title: Point Break (1991)
programme.desc: An FBI agent infiltrates a Californian surfing gang suspected of carrying out a series of armed robberies wearing masks modelled on former US presidents. However, his loyalties are tested to the limits when he is befriended by the gang's leader. Kathryn Bigelow's thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Patrick Swayze, Gary Busey and Lori Petty

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn, and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish lamb, cooking spicy Moroccan lamb chops with grilled veg couscous. programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Karan Gokani and Poppy O'Toole plus special guest Munya Chawawa. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn, and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish lamb, cooking spicy Moroccan lamb chops with grilled veg couscous. Joining them in the kitchen are Sutherland Sheep Farmer Joyce Campbell and food and drink writer Rosalind Erskine, who's mixing and pouring a Shetland gin Southside cocktail

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Fulham and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest. Plus, news from Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour the Newmarket Antiques Fair in Suffolk, with experts Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian ready to give a helping hand. Eric Knowles monitors proceedings and also challenges the crowds to guess the function of an intriguing piece of Victorian paraphernalia

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, rescuing a well-used table, a retro chair and rusty gate rods from the skip

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Birmingham to find a home in Cornwall, and visits a company making habitats for solitary bees which can also be used in the construction of houses

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Philip and Lorraine in Stockport want to transform their forgotten plot into a stately garden, on a budget of 4,750, with secret passageways, big urns, a beautiful tiled patio and lots of posh planting. Charlie Dimmock takes on the Rich Brothers to come up with a design that would not look out of place in a stately home.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Kelly Somers presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the evening session on day eight from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are up for grabs in seven events. The decathlon concludes with the javelin from 6.05 and the 1500m at 8.25, and Great Britain will expect to be in contention in the men's and women's 4x100m relays at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively given the wealth of talent at their disposal. The other finals are the men's pole vault at 6.25, the women's shot put from 7.15, the men's 800m at 7.30 and the women's 5,000m, at 7.50

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna deals with an angry Max after her confession. Rida comes to Rash's rescue. Hospital drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Fulham at Emirates Stadium and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest at Old Trafford. The Gunners are aiming to finish one better than last term when they were runners-up, but faced a potentially tough test against a Fulham side that performed well last term. The Red Devils and Forest met four times in all competitions last season, with United winning every contest. Plus, Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United and Chelsea v Luton Town

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2 (2013)
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Both of them become targets of Dave's twisted former friend, who has reinvented himself as the world's first supervillain. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey

programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. programme.title: Na Tiristich (From Tiree with Love)
programme.desc: Tiree is approximately 12 miles long, five miles wide, and has a population of around 650. Cameras reveal what it is like to live on the most westerly island in the Inner Hebrides

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: A selection of tracks from the world of trad and folk music, including Gnoss, Rachel Newton and De Temps Antan

programme.title: Sgeulachd nam Pola/The Poles Revealed
programme.desc: Science documentary taking viewers on a journey of discovery in the Arctic and Antarctic and revealing just how different these two landscapes are

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean swims in the River Etive, the water Calum claims is the most fun for a swimmer. Running between Glencoe to the sea, the river is full of amazing pools

programme.title: Na Worlds

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Sleep deprivation is affecting work productivity and is said to be costing the country billions, with one in three reportedly suffering from insomnia, and sleep apnoea now affecting one-and-a-half million people. programme.title: The Confessions of Frannie Langton

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Storm Eunice wreaks havoc at Heathrow airport, as staff deal with a deluge of delays and unhappy passengers, and also try to deter debris from hitting the runway. programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Rampage

programme.desc: Kerry Godliman, Kojo Anim, Jimmy James Jones and Humza Arshad join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Judi Love on the panel show, and take viewers on an educational and tongue-in-cheek tour of Black British history. Hosted by Jimmy Akingbola

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as the six heat winners battle it out for the 50,000 prize, each taking to the stage on their own in the guise of their idol to sing one of their hits. programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot

programme.title: The Confessions of Frannie Langton
programme.desc: In 1826, previously enslaved young woman Frannie Langton is brought from Jamaica and sent into service in the home of wealthy Londoners George and Marguerite Bentham. But when the couple are found stabbed to death, the maid finds herself accused of murder. Drama, starring Karla-Simone Spence, Sophie Cookson and Stephen Campbell Moore

programme.title: Diana's Decades
programme.desc: Princess Diana began the 1980s a shy bride and ended the decade the most photographed woman in the world. From Dynasty Di to Pop Princess to Aids champion, Diana harnessed and embodied the spirit of the 80s. As the world screamed 'Greed is Good', Diana found her voice and championed those left behind, and became, in the words of Vanity Fair's Tina Brown, 'the mouse that roared'

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd adopts a tardigrade as a pet in spite of his parents warning that they never live for long. Regardless of his efforts to keep Nutbum alive, Lloyd finds it apparently dead the next day - thankfully, Cornea knows exactly what to do!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Animated series inspired by the classic Looney Tunes shorts. Bugs Bunny has a detour, and Taz tries quenching his thirst.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. George takes Anna and Dave on a trip to a local attraction called Lawnmower Land, but a run-in with the latest technology in lawnmowing gives them more than they baaaa-gained for...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz invents the MutoFizz, a device which can render anyone mute... even the President! However, when Mr Magoo gets his hands on the invention, Fizz and Weasel end up mute, and he mistakes them for Parisian mimes.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Oti Mabuse's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The Dancing on Ice judge and former Strictly Come Dancing professional is joined in studio by Broadway star Marisha Wallace and actress Chizzy Akudolu

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at the house this morning by TV presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle, who enjoys dishes of tandoori fish and a fresh seafood pasta. Plus, recipes from chefs Phil Howard and Jonathan Phang, and Dom Van Marsh helps James plant this year's crop down in the vegetable garden

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: The chef makes dishes with fruit as the main ingredient, including figs with balsamic and honey, and a salad of orange, carrot and avocado with a zesty orange and lime dressing. Jason is joined by Daniel Birk, his own executive chef in Dubai, who samples some cocktails before creating a delicious lobster and mango dish

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James crosses over the Irish Sea to Northern Ireland, where he is joined by famous local chef Paul Rankin. Their first port of call is the Giant's Causeway, where James cooks a fish stew for the crowds, followed by a visit to a family farm in Limavady, where Paul learns how their award-winning rapeseed oil is produced. Things get competitive as the chefs compete in a hovercraft race, and finally James takes to the seas to fish for mackerel

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of the fourth and final day of the Ebor Festival, including the 3.35 Sky Bet Ebor, plus races at 1.50, 2.25, 3.00 and 4.10, and action from Goodwood. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Oli Bell, Mick Fitzgerald, Ruby Walsh and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cambridge for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Can couple Kieran and Laura win big and take their dream trip to America, will father and daughter Jermaine and Charis beat the Launcher to take home tens of thousands of pounds, and can Sarah and her brother-in-law Patrick strike it lucky to secure a deposit on a house and a holiday for the kids?

programme.title: Skyfall (2012)
programme.desc: James Bond pursues a mysterious criminal mastermind who has orchestrated a terrorist attack on MI6 headquarters and exposed the identities of undercover agents around the world. The trail leads to a rogue former operative who has a personal vendetta against the intelligence organisation's leader M - who is also facing calls to retire. Sam Mendes directs the 23rd instalment in the spy franchise, starring Daniel Craig as 007, with Javier Bardem, Judi Dench, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Phil Tufnell, Colin Jackson and Lisa Riley answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Winning Combination

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of elderly villains spot a chance for one last, glorious crime spree when the villagers leave Aidensfield en masse to support Rob in a charity football match. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Helen is accused of helping an elderly, terminally ill patient to die, a problem compounded by the strain of concealing her relationship with Rob. Meanwhile, Peggy and David go into business selling stolen strawberries - unaware that Geoff Younger is hot on their trail. Rural drama, with Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor, David Lonsdale and Steven Blakeley

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The investigation of a burglary at a quarry turns into something far more serious when a security guard's badly beaten body is discovered at the scene of the crime. An autistic teenager is arrested for the murder, despite Inspector Frost's misgivings - a move which triggers a chain of tragic events culminating in a tense stand-off. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Caroline Harker and Maurice Roeves

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The folk of Aidensfield panic when rumours of an escaped killer are confirmed. Rob attempts to track down the fugitive, but his investigations are complicated when Helen gets caught up in the case. David is left reeling when Greengrass's lurcher Alfred becomes seriously ill, and Peggy speaks to bereavement expert Bernie in the hope that he can lend support to the devastated handyman. Rural drama with David Stockwell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A priceless Manet painting is stolen from a retired German art dealer's home, leaving Miller to suspect Lord Ashfordly's involvement. Peggy tries to convince a pair of visiting bird-watchers that Aidensfield's wildlife includes a rare bird of prey, and David tries to wing it as an ornithological expert. Rural drama, starring Rupert Vansittart, John Duttine, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called to the University of Northumberland when Jamie Marshall, a promising young journalism student, falls to his death from the top of a disused faculty building. With no eyewitnesses and no immediate leads, Vera turns to friends and family to glean all she can about Jamie, and to discover who might have wanted him dead. The student's innocent facade is revealed to have concealed simmering resentment and anger which he expressed on the internet - and which may have made him some deadly enemies

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When the body of an elderly woman is discovered at a well-known suicide spot, Ronnie soon detects foul play, with suspicion falling on the victim's son and daughter-in-law, as well as a doctor who has recently arrived in the UK. However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The detectives find clues that suggest Georgia gave birth at the scene, but where is the baby now? The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jake's old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson

The victim is a respected Harley Street psychiatrist - whose three-legged dog appears to hold the key to solving the case. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The launch of the latest sparkling wine by Midsomer Vinae Winery falls flat when critic Nadia Simons gives it a scathing review, then guests sampling the vintage start to collapse. Owner William Carnarvon suspects the Farmers' Wives Association of trying to destroy his business, while his wife Diana frets over her mother Matilda, one of the victims. Pathologist Kate reveals the drink was laced with slug poison, but how is the attack connected to the death of a child in a hit-and-run? Barnaby and Nelson are called in to investigate. Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee star in the mystery drama, with Claire Bloom, Mark Bonnar, Rosie Cavaliero and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. As DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new forensic pathologist Kam Karimore investigate the mysterious crime, they find themselves drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching during their quest to identify the perpetrator. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Helen Baxendale and Navin Chowdhry

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Forest ranger Felicity Ward is blinded by mysterious lights while driving at night in the village of Cooper Hill and the next morning her car is found abandoned at the roadside, followed closely by the discovery of her body. Visiting UFO spotters in the village are convinced aliens are responsible, but as Barnaby and Nelson try to get to the truth, they unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets along the way. Michelle Collins, Steve Evets, Alison Steadman, Steve Oram and Pip Torrens guest star

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Documentary recording daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity. The team continues with its mission to find homes for abandoned dogs. programme.title: London Bridge: Facing Terror
programme.desc: Reflections of the terrorist attack of November 2019, in which Jack Merritt and Saskia Jones were killed and two other people injured by Usman Khan as he wielded a kitchen knife. Darryn Frost, Steven Gallant and John Crilly each played a role in stopping the attacker from committing further appalling deeds. However, when the past criminality of Steven and John were bought to the fore, the narrative shifted. Darryn, Steven and John share their story of the attack in detail for the first time, as well as exploring how each was shaped by events in their past, which ultimately led them to all be at Fishmongers' Hall on that fateful day

programme.title: Amputating Alice
programme.desc: Alice Tai is a Paralympic gold medallist and world record holder. However, her swimming career was put on hold after major surgery, which meant she was unable to take part in the Tokyo Olympic Games in 2020. Her long-awaited return to the pool was set to be at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, but just months before she was due to compete Alice elected to have her right leg amputated to help improve her quality of life. This documentary, narrated by Adam Hills, tells the story of Alice's fight to go from amputation to gold medal contention in just over half a year.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Energetic 32-year-old owl sanctuary volunteer Krystal worries that her larger-than-life personality and chattiness scare men off. Her date with fellow animal lover James, who's 43, starts well when she gives him a knitted owl, but will things nose dive when she discovers what he does for a living? Other participants include 20-year-old beautician and recruitment assistant Georgia, who is searching for her dream girl

As pharaoh she oversaw immense engineering works, including the construction of the Temple of Deir el-Bahri, developed important trade routes across the region, led expeditions and brought wealth and artistry to the region

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates the stories of epic train journeys through stunning scenery and natural beauty, beginning with a trip from Inverness to Edinburgh. Not long after setting out, the route passes Culloden, the site of the last pitched battle on British soil. It then enters the Cairngorms National Park, home to some of Europe's finest landscapes as well as valleys steeped in Gaelic folklore. The park's station at Aviemore is home to the Strathspey Railway, where Victorian steam locomotives come to life. There is then a climb to the highest point on Britain's railway network before the train winds its way through Fife. Eventually the route crosses the Forth Bridge before arriving in Scottish capital Edinburgh, admired for its architecture and annual arts festival. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates a trip through Wales' highest peaks and deepest valleys. Starting in Pwllheli in the north west, the route heads along the lines that were built during the slate industry's heyday. At Porthmadog, the journey briefly switches to the reconstructed steam trains of the Welsh Highland National Heritage Railway to Minffordd station. Nearby is the village of Portmeirion, famous for its role in the classic TV series The Prisoner. Rejoining the Cambrian Line, local farmers reveal what the railway means to them, before the route takes in the seaside resort of Aberdovey
