programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The programme follows Graham, a pest controller who battles critters, bugs and vermin across the Costa del Sol, as he goes on a snake hunt and is called to an ant infestation. Plus, a pair of Welsh ex-pats who moved to Spain to run a bar, and the so-called 'cat lady of the Costa del Sol', who feeds more than 100 street cats as well as taking them to the vets to be neutered

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: West Midlander Vince rushes to get his new bar ready, having mistakenly thought he was paying for a working bar when it turns out he had actually just bought the lease on the building - leaving him to do the rest himself. Meanwhile, former dancer Bambi plans a racy show to raise cash for a local dog rescue shelter, and Andy tours the coast buying and selling old furniture

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras focus on Sheffield-born market trader Jacqui, who needs to make as much as she can at the tourist night markets on the Costa del Sol prom. There's also a look at cockney former publican Victor, who has spent the past 18 years living in his motorhome. But with only his pension to live on, and his movable mansion in need of a refurb, will he have to sell up?

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Horse-rescue boss Jill rushes to the aid of an animal abandoned at a roadside. Young couple Nicole and Aaron plan to buy and refurbish a campervan so they can travel the world putting on fitness boot camps. Former call-centre employee Courtney and her boyfriend Michael get the chance to run their own bar, although their boss is soon piling on the pressure to get it open as soon as possible

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Highlights of the singer's voyages around the Mediterranean, which has seen her visit places including Rome, Florence, Pisa, Monte Carlo, Monaco and Barcelona

programme.title: When Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: A selection of disastrous excursions, featuring a visit to the zoo that ended in horror when a young family encountered an escaped chimpanzee. Plus, a day at a safari park turns to a walk on the wild side as two duelling camels cause 6,000 of damage to a car, rendering it a write-off, while a tourist soon regretted going on a hang-gliding day trip in the Swiss Alps when his pilot failed to attach the safety cord

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: The King on Holiday & Other Royal Vacations
programme.desc: Documentary looking at what the royal family do to relax, revealing their favourite places to escape from palace life. The programme explores how royal holidays have changed through the decades, from their modern passion for safaris and skiing trips, to the old penchant for the Med and Mustique

programme.title: Meghan & Fergie: Inconvenient Royal Wives
programme.desc: Exploring the parallels between Sarah, Duchess of York and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex. The film asks what the future holds for them both, and what lessons Meghan can learn from Sarah's experiences. The only previous royal to tell all on Oprah's couch was Sarah herself - once to publicise her autobiography in 1996, and then to apologise for selling out Prince Andrew to the News of the World for 500,000

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: A look at how George V's ascension to the throne in 1910 led to the birth of the House of Windsor. JJ Chalmers discovers how the highly traditional king and Queen Mary were sticklers for stuffy royal etiquette - enforcing a strict dress code and dining with bizarrely outdated formality. Alexander reveals how the First World War made the bombing of Buckingham Palace a very real possibility, so the lake in the garden was drained in an extraordinary effort to make it more difficult for enemy planes to spot

programme.title: Top of the Box
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly takes a look back at the most popular British TV programmes from a past year, beginning with 1985 and shows including 'Allo 'Allo!, Name that Tune and Crossroads, plus a famous interview with Prince Charles and Princess Diana on their fourth wedding anniversary - and a parody of it featuring the Spitting Image puppets. Featuring the last ever interview with Jim Bowen, host of Bullseye

programme.title: Scandal: Jeffrey Archer & the Call-Girl
programme.desc: A look at the controversy and scandal surrounding the author and former MP, combining testimonies, archive material and dramatic reconstruction to examine what led him to fall so dramatically from grace. From his court action against the Daily Star, after the newspaper accused him of paying off a prostitute who claimed to have slept with him, to his mayoral run and his notorious trial for perjury and eventual imprisonment, the scandals seemed endless

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates the stories of epic train journeys through stunning scenery and natural beauty, beginning with a trip from Inverness to Edinburgh. Not long after setting out, the route passes Culloden, the site of the last pitched battle on British soil. It then enters the Cairngorms National Park, home to some of Europe's finest landscapes as well as valleys steeped in Gaelic folklore. The park's station at Aviemore is home to the Strathspey Railway, where Victorian steam locomotives come to life. There is then a climb to the highest point on Britain's railway network before the train winds its way through Fife. Eventually the route crosses the Forth Bridge before arriving in Scottish capital Edinburgh, admired for its architecture and annual arts festival. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor visits York Minster, which over the past 800 years, has been a backdrop to some of the most dramatic events in British history. It houses more than half of all the world's medieval glass, including the Rose Window, commissioned by Henry VIII, and the East Window, the largest stained glass window in the world. A succession of outspoken bishops of York have defied Nazis, married kings and queens, and more recently championed equality with Archbishop John Sentamu, the country's first black bishop, consecrating the world's first female bishop, Libby Lane, in 2014

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski chronicles the history of Britain's religious art, examining the legacies of two wealthy industrialists of the 17th and 18th centuries who demonstrated a flamboyant taste for kitsch in the baroque forms of churches in Great Witley, Worcestershire, and London's Little Stanmore

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The cheeky monkey goes to the beach to find out how waves are formed and what fun can be had with them

programme.title: Charlotte's Web (2006)

While the little pig still looks destined for the chop, clever spider Charlotte hatches a plan to use her web-spinning talents to save him. Family drama, starring Dakota Fanning and featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Dominic Scott Kay, Steve Buscemi and John Cleese

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2014)
programme.desc: A reporter discovers four humanoid amphibians who live in the sewers of New York, and use their martial arts skills to fight crime. She helps them as they face their toughest challenge yet - defeating a sinister criminal organisation that seems to have power over the entire city. Fantasy adventure, starring Megan Fox and William Fichtner, with the voice of Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: Jack Reacher (2012)
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Deadpool (2016)
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin

programme.title: Lynch/Oz (2022)
programme.desc: Alexandre O'Philippe's documentary about David Lynch looks to pull back the curtain on the influence that 1939's The Wizard of Oz starring Judy Garland has had upon the director's visionary work. The film is constructed from six visual essays by David Lowery, Karyn Kusama, John Waters, Rodney Ascher, Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead, and critic Amy Nicholson

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)
programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes discover their arch enemy Shredder has returned from another dimension, and made a deal with an alien warlord. Assisted by two mutant henchman, Shredder goes in search of a lost device that will allow his new ally to mount an invasion of Earth. Action adventure sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Stephen Amell

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

However, they face a squad who uses both instruments and voices. Final part of the blockbusting comedy trilogy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

The investigator refuses to believe in the supernatural, convinced a human killer is behind the murders - but the legend proves to be all too true. Tim Burton's gothic horror, starring Johnny Depp, Christina Ricci, Miranda Richardson and Christopher Walken

Horror based on Adam Nevill's novel, starring Rafe Spall and Robert James-Collier

Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd

Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare

Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Worried that Rayne could be dangerous, Peri and Prince call in James to help dig into her past to protect Romeo. Meanwhile, Cindy turns to Diane for advice

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The youngster asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between his parents over the family's finances, prompting Mary and the twins to move in with Meemaw. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is mightily annoyed after organising the school's most successful fundraiser, only for Spanish teacher Senor Kaplan to steal his thunder. programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon kicks Amy out of the apartment so that he can have some 'alone time' to work, she and Leonard bond during a series of science experiments. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

Comedy, guest starring Regina King (Southland), with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.desc: When Dave is up for a promotion, Calvin tries to help him negotiate a raise from his penny-pinching new boss. Tina can't decide whether she should share sensitive information

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria celebrate their anniversary, but cannot decide on what kind of gift to give each other. programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales adviser Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. programme.title: Rick and Morty

programme.title: Teenage Euthanasia

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: Lottie Moss and Adam Collard have their final mixer dates in the morning, which are both sealed with a smooch. During the feedback, Vanessa Feltz gets a grilling

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Amy are forced to take an unexpected road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon after his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuart's relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadette's workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is forced to teach a course at the university, and Howard surprises the gang when he decides to enrol on it. Meanwhile, Amy plays Penny and Bernadette off against each other while the tension brews over Penny's new job. Comedy, guest starring Regina King (Southland), with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The youngster asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between his parents over the family's finances, prompting Mary and the twins to move in with Meemaw. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When his germophobia lands him in detention when flu season hits Medford, Sheldon takes extreme measures to remain healthy. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre's nieces and nephews come to the neighbourhood on Halloween to go trick-or-treating, but his own children aren't happy when their boisterous cousins drop by. Dre also gets a surprise visit from his own cousin June Bug, who used to torment him when they were children

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When Dre and Rainbow take Zoey on a trip to visit Rainbow's old university, Dre's fear of flying kicks in and he needs a little assistance to get him through the flight. programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rayne opens up to her boyfriend about her childhood trauma, Lacey decides to be true to her feelings, and Cindy decides that she doesn't need a man

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The teenage villagers celebrate their GCSE results. Elsewhere, Charlie opens up to Felix about his struggles, and Pearl invites Warren to a family dinner

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy's Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are often too distracted by their lively bar to look after their business. The national landmark, which has played host to an array of famous names including Mark Twain, President Ulysses S Grant and JP Morgan, has no dedicated accommodation manager, so guests sometimes struggle to receive the attention they need and end up feeling the hotel has become an afterthought beside the noisy saloon

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Connecticut's oldest inn, the Curtis House in Woodbury, which has been owned by the Hardisty family for generations. However, the business has started to fall apart and their legacy is on the brink of being lost. Siblings Chris and TJ, who are in charge, no longer speak to each other and the staff and guests feel stuck in the middle

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When Mary takes a job as church secretary, she finds herself becoming a marriage counsellor to Pastor Jeff. Sheldon and Missy spend their first afternoon at home alone. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Raegan Revord

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Sheldon makes friends with an upper-class senior pupil who introduces him to a new field of science. Meanwhile, Mary and George disagree on how to handle Sheldon's blossoming social life

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: As the wedding of Gina's mother and Boyle's father arrives, each member of the squad is given a task to complete for the big day. However, Peralta and Santiago get sidetracked chasing a criminal, and Jeffords struggles to officiate at the ceremony. Comedy, guest starring Sandra Bernhard and Nick Cannon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake's seldom-seen father Roger arrives to spend some time with his son, but Charles is sceptical of his true motives. Meanwhile, Holt tests Amy, Terry, Gina and Rosa with a near-impossible brain teaser in exchange for tickets to a Beyonce concert. Guest starring Bradley Whitford (The West Wing)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A day at the museum proves to be anything but fun when Cam, Mitch and Manny realise they can't hold their own against brainbox Alex. Claire is less than enthusiastic when she and Gloria go shopping to buy a dress for Lily, while Jay imparts some manly pearls of wisdom to grandson Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. Phil spends most of his time with his magician heroes - neglecting Claire in the process - and Mitch runs into an ex-boyfriend he dumped by e-mail, although it all seems fine when he invites Mitch and Cam to his bachelor party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj finds himself in the middle of a domestic drama when he realises that the woman he's dating, Nell, has a husband, Oliver, who is very upset about their new relationship. Sheldon rents his old room back to have a quiet place to work and drives Leonard crazy by being a model tenant

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon petitions Wil Wheaton to allow him to appear on the new Professor Proton show, so the actor offers a guest appearance to Amy instead. Meanwhile, Penny gets angry when she thinks the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin hires Grover to work part-time at his business, but soon realises that he's not a good fit. Marty and Necie reconsider their living situation

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Calvin's favourite restaurant closes and is replaced by a flashy pet spa, he worries that the community is losing too many small businesses and starts a buy-local campaign

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil comes across footage of an incriminating sneeze while looking at Cameron and Mitchell's wedding video that proves he is responsible for the family's flu epidemic, so he sets about getting rid of the proof with the help of Luke and some creative editing. Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is being treated for mould, but when they are forced to share a single room, cabin fever soon sets in. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's honeymoon runs aground in New York, Penny and Leonard discover that they are uncomfortably similar to Amy's parents, while Raj insults astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson and starts a war on social media. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

Live-action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit two sisters at their south Wales workshop, where their restorations and upcycles include a Gothic-style organ and a half-size snooker table

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole comes across a tractor and Simon O'Brien finds a small-wheeled design classic as the pair search for money-making items in Norfolk

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers search for heirs on a huge family tree, and spend days trying to track them down. Plus, the investigation into a former civil servant's 160,000 estate, and details of more unclaimed properties

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The pair's quirky hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the 'no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Tuck family in Long Eaton, Derbyshire, who have grown weary of their cramped, three bedroom semi-detached home. Kirstie offers her thoughts on ways the family could change the downstairs of the property, while Phil sets out to find a suitable house they could buy instead

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chimp Zee Zee gives birth to a daughter and keepers hope her arrival will have a calming influence on the others. Meanwhile, chameleon Mr Parsons is set up with a young female, banteng mother Naya struggles to bond with her newly born calf, and elephant Nadita should be looking after baby Anjan, but would rather play with her boisterous cousin, Aayu

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Emily hopes that bringing a dog into the family home will provide a calming influence for her neurodiverse son Jacob. Digger the Jack Russell is suspected of being ideal emotional support for young Harper

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Metal worker John Lloyd search for his own, affordable home has led him to floating homes on the Medway in Kent. John has spent almost all of his funds on a boat that is going to need a lot of work, from rotting timber to a total refurb. His father Pete helps out, as their combined skills with repurposing and reclaiming prove that almost anything is possible

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Having spent two years scouring Australia for the perfect plot, Catherine and Mick settle on 50 acres atop the spectacular rolling hills of South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. They begin building a remarkable structure that looks more like a corrugated iron shed than a house

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at King's with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Metal worker John Lloyd search for his own, affordable home has led him to floating homes on the Medway in Kent. John has spent almost all of his funds on a boat that is going to need a lot of work, from rotting timber to a total refurb. His father Pete helps out, as their combined skills with repurposing and reclaiming prove that almost anything is possible

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man has a blackout driving a van and crashes into a telegraph pole. This is the second time it has happened in as many weeks and paramedics are keen to find out why

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at King's with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: After falling in love with Fuerteventura's breathtaking scenery eight years earlier, Mandy and Peter have dreamt of swapping their island life in Jersey for the warmer climate of the Canaries. Armed with a budget of 127,000 Jasmine Harman shows them five properties on their budget of 127,000, hoping one will tick all their boxes

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is house-hunting in the foothills of the spectacular Sierra Nevada mountain range with Mark and his son Luke. Keen adventurer Mark has spent two years on an overseas cycling tour and now wants to pack up his four bikes and relocate to the Spanish countryside. He's looking for a character property with enough space for Luke to come and visit. Armed with a maximum budget of 150,000, Danni finds five options to tempt Mark

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the summer draws to a close in France, brewers from Kent create a new beer for a medieval chateau, and a couple from London serve afternoon tea. At a B&B in Italy, the hosts cook a fabulous dinner for guests

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head to Suffolk to meet Margaret, an avid collector who is also a former mayor, so they need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company tries to find beneficiaries to the 400,000 estate of a woman from Enfield, before hearing news that threatens the whole investigation. Elsewhere, the case of a missing man who lived in a shed for 20 years, who left behind a full military pension and substantial savings. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are still to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Trecarne House in Liskeard, Cornwall, where owners Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The pair win the group's admiration by sharing their life story, but one guest stirs up intrigue by holding his cards close to his chest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners spend their second night of the competition at the Magna Carta at Windsor in Berkshire, a five-star floating bed and breakfast run by Captain Dominic Read. The guests are pleasantly surprised upon arrival, but not all are impressed by the standard of the accommodation - and a cracked teapot at the breakfast table leads to trouble for the proprietor

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is Ash Cottage near Leeds Castle in Kent, where the unusual decor is an eye-opener for the guests but is not everyone's cup of tea. Trish and Tom get heated over the instant coffee before owners Rayne and Chris Deal take their fellow contestants to Chatham Dockyard to try their hands at rope-making

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is A Room with a View in Brighton, where owner Stephen Bull and housekeeper Joanna Harris hope their nine-room establishment will impress the contestants. Things get off to a good start when Rayne and Chris Deal are impressed by the cleanliness of the property, but things take a turn for the worse when breakfast gets the thumbs down

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their critics face-to-face. Hosts of Trecarne House in Cornwall Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan raise issues with Magna Carta's Dominic Read on his mark for their hosting, while he has a bone to pick with them over criticism of his five-star floating B&B. Stephen and Joanna of A Room with a View in Brighton receive complaints about their breakfast, and tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help the Clayton-Fishers, who have fallen out of love with their home in Walthamstow, east London. Sarah and her wife Pepper have opposing views on what to do with their two-bedroom terrace, as Sarah thinks it is time to move on, but Pepper is digging her heels in and wants to convert the loft

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Pregnant rhino Asha goes into labour overnight, meaning there is a surprise waiting for the keepers when they arrive to work the next morning. Meanwhile, Malayan tapirs Margery and Betong say goodbye to their daughter, Solo, who is leaving to start a new life at a zoo in Germany, and female dead leaf mantis Minnie is looking for her first partner

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Long-term resident at Animal Welfare League, Harley the American bull cross, is often overlooked for adoption due to his size - will his personality help him find a new home? Meanwhile, Staffordshire terrier mix Banksy turns on the charm

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi Waterstone and her partner Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of 150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Rig 45: Murder at Sea
programme.desc: Trevor and Emma ask the Benthos staff for help, but the staff are uncooperative as Petra is the police's responsibility. Captain Aksel is frustrated at the lack of contact with his ship, which is still unreachable across the water. Drama, starring Andrei Alen, Ciarn McMenamin, Dmitry Vinokurov and Lisa Henni. In English and Swedish

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Peggy, 85, arrives at the hospital by ambulance, having injured her knee at home. It's the second time she has fallen in two months and medics want to find out if there's a more serious underlying cause. Meanwhile, the team keeps a close eye on 75-year-old Bob, who has had a suspected heart attack, and Ben, 25, isn't overly concerned by his swollen finger, until a doctor diagnoses cellulitis

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Schoolboy Eddie, 12, is brought into A&E having been hit by a car on his way home from school, and doctors are concerned he may have suffered a bleed on the brain, as well as damage to his kidneys. Meanwhile, 64-year-old Linda, who breathes with the help of a tracheostomy, arrives at King's after experiencing respiratory failure at home, and student Amy, 20, has been coughing up blood

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont take on Roisin Conaty and Joe Wilkinson in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while Bec Hill joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. For the past seven years she has been caring for her husband, who is disabled after having a stroke. Owning a holiday home that can provide some respite for herself and his wonderful team of carers is really important, so the pressure is really on for Jasmine Harman to deliver the perfect property for her budget of 135,000

programme.title: Food Unwrapped Investigates
programme.desc: Kate Quilton investigates the junk-food diets of children who are fussy eaters, visiting one of the largest studies into childhood eating habits in the world to find out what is reasonable to categorise as normal behaviour and when parents should seek help. She learns about a newly discovered eating disorder that has so far been largely undiagnosed and could be behind thousands of cases of fussy eating in the UK

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonathan and Stephen have busy lives running their own businesses, and can't wait to buy a holiday home near the glitzy town of Marbella on Spain's Costa del Sol. The couple are looking for an apartment near the beach, where they can chill out with friends while enjoying spectacular sea views on Spain's sunshine coast. With a budget of 250,000 Jean Johansson rises to the challenge, presenting the pair with five property options to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Celebrity photographer John wants to celebrate his 60th birthday by relocating to the idyllic Greek Island of Skopelos. Having fallen in love with its beautiful scenery and relaxing way of life, all he needs is to find his dream property - so friend Helen is coming along for support. Ben Hillman selects five options to put in the frame for his 120,000 budget, hoping at least one will be John's idea of perfection

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, on their second stay, where proprietors Graham and Julia Ashley treat them to an afternoon of indoor sky-diving before hosting a dinner filled with surprises. The guests enjoy a good night's sleep, but one of the owners is expecting hassle at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osbourne appears to take a rather laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impressions of the communal living space-come-mini art gallery - but it's not long before they are dishing the dirt

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition draws to a close at the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse in Chard, Somerset, where owners Andrew and Clare Ashmore hope to excite their guests with a game of skittles. During the final dinner of the week, the competitors discuss their first impressions of each other, and Bob and Julia share some amusing observations with the group

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners confront their critics face to face, and the winners are announced. Nateby Inn host Gaynor takes issue with Graham and Julia's reduced marks for cobwebs. The conversation becomes heated when Outfields Farm's owners tackle Gaynor's complaints in return, and Georgie jumps to their defence. Artist Bob Osborne has a long list of grievances he wants to address, and Julia is left cringing when her previous comments rebound on her

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In 2003, Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp were tasked with finding homes that would bring two pairs of lovebirds together. A frustrating 10-mile gap was keeping Annmarie and Robert apart, while 300 miles separated Alison and Martin. Twelve years later, the hosts find out whether either or both couples remain together in the United Kingdom

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the quarter final, the five remaining teams create 24 savoury puff pastries and three sharing-sized brioche feuillete in just three and a half hours. The second challenge combines sugar and chocolate work and must fit the theme of 'A Life of Amphibians and Reptiles', the teams have five hours to create 30 individual desserts to incorporate into their final showpiece

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Hastings and Rye in East Sussex, where the first host is 52-year-old nursery owner Louise, who plans a fun-filled evening of Thai food. Her guests are horse-mad Emily, who's 40, 56-year-old Caribbean takeaway owner Clive, 23-year-old beauty therapist Chiara and mature student and self-confessed foodie Gary. A power cut threatens to scupper Louise's night before it's even started, until her husband - and farmer - Roddy and his generator come to the rescue. Will the night impress the guests, and particularly the self-appointed Thai food expert at the table?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second night from Hastings and Rye in East Sussex sees host Emily plan an evening of comfort food, including carrot and parsnip soup, meat loaf and apple and blackberry crumble

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Australian mature student Gary hosts the third dinner party from Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, planning an evening filled with fun, flash and fabulous flavour

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dec, a former member of 1960s band the Bachelors, hosts the next dinner party from Hastings and Rye, planning to impress his guests with musical surprises and a simple seaside menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, beauty therapist Chiara returns to her roots to throw an Italian dinner party. However, Irish crooner Dec gets on his host's wrong side when he questions her interest in healing crystals and likens her to a page three glamour girl

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix takes a culinary tour of Rome with Michelin-starred chef Giorgio Locatelli. They head for the Vatican City in search of one of the most unusual cheap eats money can buy, courtesy of legendary pizza maker Gabrielle Bonci. Giorgio takes Fred out of the city centre to one of Rome's finest trattorias, and discovers how much the city's food scene owes to keeping old traditions alive

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany visits Gobustan in Azerbaijan, and uncovers 40,000-year-old rock art which tells the tales of the earliest inhabitants of this desert landscape. She then heads to Shaki, an important stop for merchants travelling on the ancient Silk Road. She meets weavers still making silk in the traditional way and explores the remarkable palace of glass built from the riches of their trade. Venturing into the Caucasus mountains, Bettany discovers why Azerbaijan is known as the Land of Fire

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors are concerned that 38-year-old Stacie may be paralysed following a fall from a tree at a friend's all-night party, while 19-year-old veterinary student Ashleigh is rushed into A&E after being involved in a high-speed head-on car crash. Elsewhere, Peter, 78, arrives at King's with abdominal pains, and as he receives treatment, he paints a picture of his eventful life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London. Meanwhile, 79-year-old Doreen has broken her wrist in a fall at home, and parents Keeley and Michael are concerned by the fact their toddler Cydney hasn't urinated for two days

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May attempt to improve the ambulance, with the presenters all going their own separate ways to enhance one area they think could do with an overhaul. Local tradespeople and members of the community muck in to help the builders create a new single-storey extension in just nine days, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to protect her vision

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: A cherished wartime iron workhorse needs to be hauled 160 miles from the Churnet Valley Railway in Staffordshire to a winter extravaganza in Oxfordshire

programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britain's best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles heads to Maidstone, Kent, to meet former Royal Engineer and paratrooper Mo Morris. After 20 years in the service, he was given a medical discharge due to damage to his knees, and has been left struggling to walk unaided ever since. At present, his home is unsuited to his needs, putting pressure on his relatives as they try to help as best they can. Determined to give him back his independence, the DIY SOS team rallies the local troops, including tradespeople and neighbours, to work together and adapt Mo's house, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to make sure everything goes to plan

programme.title: Train Truckers

programme.desc: Rick boards the ferry in Penzance to take him to the Isles of Scilly, where he learns about the islands' rich history, including one of the Royal Navy's worst shipping disasters in which 1500 men lost their lives. programme.title: Top Gear

With Land Rover production ceasing in the UK later this year, Richard Hammond pays tribute to the 4x4 by attempting to drive one straight up the side of a dam, while James May puts the Mercedes AMG GT through its paces. Taking to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car are Will Smith and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris put emergency vehicles to the test to see if the fire brigade, the police or the ambulance service has the fastest vehicles. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles heads to Maidstone, Kent, to meet former Royal Engineer and paratrooper Mo Morris. After 20 years in the service, he was given a medical discharge due to damage to his knees, and has been left struggling to walk unaided ever since. At present, his home is unsuited to his needs, putting pressure on his relatives as they try to help as best they can. Determined to give him back his independence, the DIY SOS team rallies the local troops, including tradespeople and neighbours, to work together and adapt Mo's house, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to make sure everything goes to plan

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Comedy actors Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer travel to the picturesque River Usk in south Wales, where Paul's father first taught him to fish as a young child. The duo discuss their respective childhoods and reflect on their own family lives and values. In their cosy cottage accommodation in the heart of the countryside they compare school photographs and Paul serenades Bob with his guitar. Once outside in the picturesque environment, their quarry is the wild brown trout

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer brave the wild lakes of Essex in search of the mighty carp. They have the latest high-tech equipment to catch the biggest fish they can - and are fully prepared to stay all night if they have to. The pair discuss the true meaning of a mid-life crisis and decide to visit a beauty clinic to see whether there are any suitable treatments available to re-capture their youth. Bob reveals his secret recipe to make the perfect scrambled eggs - but it's not the only thing that shocks Paul

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The clan's visit to the Second World War graves in Normandy gets off to a bad start when Lucy discovers that her grandfather was not the man she thought he was. In short, this seems to be a piece of family history best left buried. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A family Christmas party turns sour when Lucy announces that she has got tickets to see Jason Donovan in Panto. Lee loathes Panto - especially given the Aussie actor was Lucy's teenage crush. That night, Lee has an unsettling dream in which he is dressed as Buttons and his whole life has turned into a Pantomime. Lucy is Cinderella, Toby and Anna are the Ugly Sisters, Geoffrey is Baron Hardup and Wendy is Fairy Godmother. Worse still, Prince Charming - the handsome suitor who pursues Cinderella and asks for her hand in marriage - is Jason Donovan. Can Buttons keep the fairy-tale couple apart? Festive edition of the comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, and featuring a guest appearance by a certain former soap star

programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook, Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they have left behind. He begins in Manchester, where he finds out how the world's first industrialised city produced a revolutionary political movement, and learns about the railway workers who founded one of the most successful football clubs of all time. Along the way, the presenter does the washing in Port Sunlight - a model village on the Wirral - and hears stories about the aptly named George Francis Train's time in Birkenhead, Merseyside

He then travels to Austria via Bratislava in Slovakia, and in Vienna he immerses himself in pre-First World War decadence. From there he heads to Salzburg, before going on to the Salzkammergut region to visit the emperor's Austrian summer residence at Bad Ischl, where in 1914 Franz Joseph I signed a declaration that changed the course of European history

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, beginning his journey in Berlin - which at the beginning of the 20th Century was a powerhouse of science and technology. Led by his copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, he heads west via the Harz Mountains to the industrial Ruhr Valley to learn how imperial Germany was ready for war. He then goes south along the tourist trail of the castle-studded Rhine river and ends in the Rheingau to taste the wines of its vineyards

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of early 20th-century travellers, Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Switzerland, which was a favourite with Edwardian tourists. He begins in Basel, travels east to visit the industrial regions of Zurich and learns about the engineering feats needed to thread the rail network through the Alps. He takes in the striking beauty of Lake Lucerne, before ending with an ascent by train to Europe's highest station at Jungfraujoch

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Holland and Belgium, before travelling to the French sector of the Western Front. He ends his journey in the Forest of Compiegne in northern France to hear how the First World War armistice was signed in a railway carriage

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, American-born Gerald takes his guests Stateside with a menu of diner classics, but he soon finds himself on the back foot when finicky foodie Anthony gives his grub a grilling. Later there's Presidential name dropping, dubious doppelgangers and as the evening draws to a close, preening and pouting when the diners take part in a bizarre beauty pageant

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Edinburgh, geography teacher Ashley hopes her magical evening of enchanted food will send her to the top of the leaderboard to secure the 1,000 prize. The soire begins well with American Gerald, whose fear of mushed up peas is banished over the pea soup starter and even Anthony has his tastes changed when it comes to curried scallops. Fussy-eater Sharon, however has a few harsh words to share over her main of wild-caught trout, while museum worker Carmen enjoys a front row seat to the continued bickering between Anthony and Sharon

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A Berkshire couple running a Spanish cycling company that has been affected by the pandemic try to attract custom closer to home, and two gte owners tackle a big renovation

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps twin sisters Sona and Roopa Modi find a holiday home on the Costa de Almeria for a budget of 90,000, but presents them with a hard choice between several attractive properties

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Sara and Paul from Derbyshire to find a holiday home in the Murcia region of south-eastern Spain. They're amazed by what their budget of 38,000 can buy them, but whether can they decide which property suits them best remains to be seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natasha Conti hosts the first dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and puts together an evening on the theme of a summer fete, complete with prizes for her fellow competitors. However, as the guests get to know each other, Chris Hiller finds himself in an awkward situation

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm manager Sophie McConnell hopes that her pig-racing entertainment will impress the guests on her night as host in Salisbury, Wiltshire. She also plans to serve her home-raised cow Levi for the main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Brown-Hovelt hosts the third dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and his menu includes Uzbekistani food and porridge ice-cream. The former army major dresses as an American sailor, but Natasha Conti does not find the outfit as appealing as she had hoped

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing support officer Chris Hiller plans an eclectic but affordable menu for his night in Salisbury, Wiltshire, including chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. However, with the sole focus being on keeping costs low, his efforts might not go down well with the other guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Care worker Jane Arnold hosts the final dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, hoping to impress her guests with food from her local area. However, it is her bedroom revelations that catch the diners' attentions, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Originally from Lithuania, Reda met Greg while she was working at a hotel in London. Now, almost nine years later, they have sold their home and are all set for a life in Spain and to enjoy everything the country has to offer. Lee lines up five great options, within their budget of 100,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Florida's Gulf Coast is Sue Hyde and Ray Covelly's number one holiday destination, and now that they're engaged, it's where they want to buy their very first property and continue to enjoy everything the sunshine state has to offer. Scarlette Douglas shows them five attractive properties for their budget of 185,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sue and Mike Bloomfield from Manchester have been holidaying in Portugal for over 20 years. Now that their children have flown the nest - and with Mike's retirement just around the corner - they think the time's right to buy a holiday home on the Algarve, so Jasmine Harman shows them five properties within their budget of 150,000

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary recording daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity. The team continues with its mission to find homes for abandoned dogs. This time there's Millie and Max, a couple of Jack Russell cross pugs, a little pooch called Rex, a 13-week-old Jack Russell puppy called Albie and 'escape artist' Lily the beagle

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns for its first series outside London - at the Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham. Sister Lou tells her story of working at the hospital for more than 30 years and how her life completely changed in her 50s. Forty-five-year-old Kirsty has been rushed into QMC after an accident at a fun run. The team members carry out extensive tests on 93-year-old John, who is suffering from shortness of breath, and in the children's emergency unit, seven-year-old Hunter is being assessed after falling from a tree

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes - and in the cockpit - with the personnel at RAF Lossiemouth, as global tensions, including with Russia, impact on missions both at home and abroad. In the first episode, RAF pilot Jake Desmond is sent to NATO's frontline to face off against three Russian jets, and rookie pilot Harry Brooks tries to earn his wings and qualify for live operations

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mother Linda, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher, Martin and Roman Kemp, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Alsh and Mel C and her brother Paul, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on Stranger Things, This Is MY House, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, For Soccer Aid, The Savoy, Million Pound Pawn, Romeo and Duet, and BBC News reporting on the demise of Neighbours

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Traitors, Gino's Cooking up Love, Lady Chatterley's Lover, I Can See Your Voice, Blowing LA, This Morning and White Christmas

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr, Susie Dent and Rachel Riley host a compilation of best bits from the anarchic letters and numbers game, featuring Sean Lock, Jon Richardson, Joe Wilkinson, Lucy Beaumont, Bob Mortimer, Rosie Jones, Paul Foot, Kevin Bridges, Nick Helm and Victoria Coren-Mitchell among others

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the quarter final, the five remaining teams create 24 savoury puff pastries and three sharing-sized brioche feuillete in just three and a half hours. The second challenge combines sugar and chocolate work and must fit the theme of 'A Life of Amphibians and Reptiles', the teams have five hours to create 30 individual desserts to incorporate into their final showpiece

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners converge at Caroline Weaver's Whychurch Farm Glamping in Wiltshire. Kenny and Ben are pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness, but Billy and Tracy feel a little cramped in their pod. A day spent helping out on the on-site farm isn't to everyone's taste, but an evening barbecue is a massive hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Lazy Pug in Warwickshire. Friends Ash and Rosie are hoping to win over their guests with quirky rooms and a healthy dose of neon lights

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals head to the Crofts Hotel in Cardiff, run by chef Lorraine. However, the guests are uninspired by the bland decoration and feel that everything is a bit basic

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals spend the night at the Hollybush Inn in Priors Marston, Warwickshire, where owner Anthony hopes to wow his guests with the 16th-century coaching inn's history

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners arrive at The Pretty Thing glampsite in St Osyth, Essex, run by Phil. There's a melee of mixed emotions when the guests arrive, with Lorraine and Anthony left feeling cold by the communal showers, while Ash and Rosie embrace all the impressive luxury their Aztec tent has to offer. Over drinks, Phil lets slip that the breakfast service the following morning will be his first ever

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the B&Bers reconvene to feud about facilities, bicker over beds and cross swords over sausages, before the payments are revealed and the winner announced. Garish neon lights, dogs at breakfast and cleanliness issues are on the agenda as the hoteliers get heated while discussing a colourful week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week's competition comes from in and around Chelmsford, where the first host, NHS nurse Sam, throws a doctors and nurses-themed dinner party to win 1000

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Chelmsford, sales manager Elliot hopes to impress his guests with his mum's Guyanese recipes on his Carribean party themed night. Health centre manager Mia is worried about the menu as she doesn't like curries while vegan business owner Russ has made it clear he likes his food hot

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business owner Russell prepares a vegan menu for his guests at his black tie and slippers party on the third night in Chelmsford. His play for the prize is anything but straightforward and leaves his guests guessing about his game plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's night four in and around Chelmsford, and 'fabulous' Fran - nurturing, kind and always ready to go extra - brings some razzle dazzle to her night. She's determined to raise the bar with her food and make an all-out stab at grabbing the 1,000 cash prize. But will her halloumi stack impress her guests? And will her competitive streak knock their sublime confidence in their own abilities?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in and around Chelmsford, health centre manager Mia aims to impress her guests with some Iberian cuisine. NHS nurse Sam cannot make head nor tail of the menu, while vegetarian charity director Fran is worried that Mia could be serious competition as she's been very critical and given little away about herself all week. Vegan business owner Russ is intrigued to see if Mia can step out of the shadows and blow them all away with her food and hosting skills, while sales manager Elliot isn't convinced by the menu or the prospect of Mia's planned soiree

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: East Anglia is the setting as another three couples try to prove they are the best when it comes to throwing a dinner party. Flashy Paul and Jill kick things off with an Indian buffet, inspired by their regular trips abroad. On day two, young lovebirds Tom and Bonnie try to save their bacon with a breakfast-themed evening, before gym bunnies Neil and Emma swap weights for scales in an attempt to live up to t heir guests' high expectations. But who will grab the grand?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: For Dave and Kelly Elly there's never been another island that compares to Lanzarote. They holidayed there as just friends five years earlier, and now they're married cannot wait to buy a holiday home to enjoy with their families. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their 160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and Ellis from East Sussex cannot wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca, where they plan to spend every moment in the sunshine indulging their passion for water sports and mountain biking. Laura Hamilton leaves no stone unturned, showing them five properties for their budget of 60,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Liz and Dave celebrate their silver wedding anniversary by finding their dream holiday home in Fuerteventura on a budget of 120,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Semi-retired children's nurse Tracey is looking for a holiday home in La Duquesa on Spain's Costa del Sol and she brings along her friend Jackie for moral support. Property expert Jasmine Harman has five attempts to find Tracey the perfect place on a budget of 140,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of 100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud reviews the progress of Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs, who set out three years previously to turn a dilapidated 18th-century manor house in the remote Creuse region of central France into a B&B. At the time, he was concerned to find they did not speak the language, planned to do most of the work themselves and only had enough money to survive for a year

programme.desc: The firearms squad goes after a suspect who is believed to own a large number of weapons. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jimmy and his dog Boas find a dangerous weapon, while Kev and Pete are involved in a high-speed pursuit. An armed response team is called out to deal with a drunken man brandishing a gun, while Andy is confronted with am aggressive drink driver refusing to take a breath test

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Paul Jackson has his work cut out stopping a runaway van driver who is causing havoc, while a street disturbance leads Paul Faulkner and Lee Wilson to stare down the barrels of a shotgun. Plus, Kev Salter and the team raid a cannabis farm and make a shocking discovery

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect dies while being restrained by Ziva, who finds herself accused of using undue force and becomes the subject of an internal investigation. To make matters worse, Jenny is kidnapped by the dead man's brother, who demands a consignment of impounded heroin in exchange for her release. Drama, guest starring Connor Trinneer (Enterprise) and Tamara Taylor (Bones), with Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs is injured in an explosion while conducting inquiries aboard a ship. He lapses into a coma, during which he has flashbacks of the past he has always kept hidden. Meanwhile, Tony takes over the investigation, but his approach begins to cause friction

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gibbs emerges from his coma, but is suffering from amnesia - hindering the team's attempts to unravel a terrorist plot, as he is the only person likely to possess information on the would-be perpetrator's plans. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is stopped by police because his car matches the description of one involved in a drug deal, and a bag of cocaine is found in the boot. He is taken into custody and the other Reagans unite to formulate a plan to get him out of the mess, but evidence mounts up that points to his guilt. Drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Garland asks Benson to investigate an unusual domestic violence case when his neighbour is found injured. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Demore Barnes

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and the SVU team investigate the death of a man they believe to be a pedophile. When they dig deeper, they realise things are not what they seem, and as matters progress the case actually hits quite close to home. Drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Kelli Giddish

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky works on a case involving his estranged childhood best friend, travelling to London with Special Agent Bishop to interview his pal's family and co-workers. While away, the detective reflects on his own past choices, and examines how they have affected his present life. Alice Krige guest stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team is assigned to a joint terrorism task force by the Secretary when a Moscow-born scientist who it is believed may have been targeted by the Russians for selling state secrets, is found dead. The trail appears to lead to a friend of Sofia's, another scientist who worked for Russia and who may have succumbed to professional jealousy. However, when she too is found dead, the team discovers the hallmarks of Sergei Mishnev, the terrorist who nearly killed Gibbs. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of an apartment block resident prompts Briscoe and Green to investigate her long-standing battle with the landlord in the hope of finding a credible suspect. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. The episode also looks at the case of the Hounslow Slasher, a man who in 2012 randomly attacked lone women while they were travelling home at night. Nick Wallis presents
